rev.comment: how is having a bunch of corporate slogans in the lead helpful or useful? how about I copy a bunch of altria's mission statements and plug it into its article lead--fair? hardly.

'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 15,916 full-time employees (as of [[September 30]] [[2007]]).<ref name=q32007results /> Google's mission statement is, "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on [[January 6]], [[2007]].</ref> It is the largest American company (by [[market capitalization]]) that is not part of the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]].{{fact|date=December 2007}} Google's corporate philosophy includes statements such as "[[Don't be evil]]" and "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun", illustrating a somewhat relaxed corporate culture.
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 15,916 full-time employees (as of [[September 30]] [[2007]]).<ref name=q32007results /> It is the largest American company (by [[market capitalization]]) that is not part of the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]].{{fact|date=December 2007}}
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States dollar|US$]]1.67 billion, making it worth US$23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States dollar|US$]]1.67 billion, making it worth US$23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
